TEM-61 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
TEM-63 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-65 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
TEM-66 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
TEM-67 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in Proteus mirabilis.
TEM-68 is an inhibitor resistant, extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-70 is a beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-71 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-72 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Proteus mirabilis and Morganella morganii.
TEM-73 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
TEM-74 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
TEM-75 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
TEM-76 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-77 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in E. coli and Proteus mirabilis.
TEM-78 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-79 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-80 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in Enterobacter cloacae.
TEM-81 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-82 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-83 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-84 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-85 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-86 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-87 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Proteus mirabilis.
TEM-88 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-89 is an inhibitor-resistant, extended-spectrum beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
TEM-90 is a broad-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-91 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-92 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Proteus mirabilis.
TEM-93 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-94 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-93 is a broad-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-96 is a beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-101 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-102 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
TEM-103 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase that has been found in E. coli.
TEM-104 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-105 is a beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-106 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-107 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-108 is a beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
TEM-109 is an inhibitor-resistant, extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-110 is a broad-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-111 is a beta-lactamase found in E. coli and P. mirabilis
TEM-112 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-113 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Proteus mirabilis.
TEM-114 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Enterobacter aerogenes.
TEM-115 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-116 is a broad-spectrum beta-lactamase found in many species of bacteria.
TEM-117 is a beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
TEM-118 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
TEM-120 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella oxytoca.
TEM-121 is an inhibitor-resistant, extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli and Enterobacter aerogenes.
TEM-122 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-123 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Proteus mirabilis.
TEM-124 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Morganella morganii.
TEM-125 is a CMT-type, inhibitor-resistant, extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-126 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-127 is a broad-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-128 is a broad-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-129 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella oxytoca.
TEM-130 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-131 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Salmonella enterica.
TEM-132 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli and Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-133 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-134 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Citrobacter koseri.
TEM-135 is a broad-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Salmonella enterica.
TEM-136 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-137 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Shigella sonnei.
TEM-138 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Salmonella enterica.
TEM-139 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-141 is a broad-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Enterobacter cloacae.
TEM-142 is an beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-143 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-144 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Salmonella enterica.
TEM-145 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-146 is a beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
TEM-147 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
TEM-148 is a TEM beta-lactamase.
TEM-149 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Enterobacter aerogenes.
TEM-150 is a beta-lactamase found in Enterobacter spp., E. coli, and Klebsiella pneumoniae.
TEM-151 is a CMT-type, inhibitor-resistant, extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.

A novel bleomycin resistance protein encoded by a metallo-beta-lactamase-associated ble gene. Expression of BRP(MBL) confers resistance to bleomycin and bleomycin-like antibiotics in Enterobacteriaceae and Acinetobacter, where it is co-expressed with an MBL and controlled by the same promoter region.
Inactivation of an antibiotic by formation of a complex, preventing interaction of the antibiotic with its target.
A gene whose product inactivates an antibiotic by formation of a complex, preventing interaction of the antibiotic with its target.

In methicillin sensitive S. aureus (MSSA), beta-lactams bind to native penicillin-binding proteins (PBPs) and disrupt synthesis of the cell membrane's peptidoglycan layer. In methicillin resistant S. aureus (MRSA), foreign PBP2a acquired by lateral gene transfer is able to perform peptidoglycan synthesis in the presence of beta-lactams.
A foreign PBP2a acquired by lateral gene transfer that able to perform peptidoglycan synthesis in the presence of beta-lactams.
Multidrug resistance protein MdtM
Multidrug resistance protein MdtL
Multidrug resistance protein MdtH

Alternative dihydropteroate synthase dfr present on plasmids produces alternate proteins that are less sensitive to trimethoprim from inhibiting its role in folate synthesis, thus conferring trimethoprim resistance.

Elfamycins are molecules that inhibit bacterial elongation factor Tu (EF-Tu), a key protein which brings aminoacyl-tRNA (aa-tRNA) to the ribosome during protein synthesis. Elfamycins defined by their target (EF-Tu), rather than a conserved chemical backbone. Elfamycins follow two mechanisms to disrupt protein synthesis: 1. kirromycins and enacyloxin fix EF-Tu in the GTP bound conformation and lock EF-Tu onto the ribosome, and 2. pulvomycin and GE2270 cover the binding site of aa-tRNA disallowing EF-Tu from being charged with aa-tRNA. All elfamycins cause increased the affinity of EF-Tu for GTP.

Factumycin is a kirromycin-like antibiotic produced by Kitasatospora setae and Streptomyces strains. Its biosynthetic cluster has been characterized which has interesting acetyl transferase domains in trans, or outside of the polyketide synthase domains. Factumycin has specific, rather than broad spectrum, antibacterial properties, especially targeting various Acinetobacter baumanii strains.
A macrolide antibiotic from Streptomyces narbonensisB subsp.B josamyceticus. The drug has antimicrobial activity against a wide spectrum of pathogens.
Produced by Streptomyces bikiniensis
Produced by Streptomyces mycarofaciens.
Produced by MicromonosporaB griseorubida.
Produced by Micromonospora megalomicia.
Produced by Streptomyces narbonensis.
Kitasamycin is a macrolide antibiotic and is produced by Streptoverticillium kitasatoense. The drug has antimicrobial activity against a wide spectrum of pathogens.
Produced by Streptomyces halstedii and Streptomyces thermotolerans.
Produced by Micromonospora rosaria.
Produced by Streptomyces caelestis.
Produced by Streptomyces caelestis, which also produces the macrolide niddamycin.
Produced by Streptomyces venezuelae ATCC 15439.
Produced by Streptomyces venezuelae ATCC 15439.

Kirromycin, also known as mocimycin, is the representative molecule of its own class of elfamycins which is composed of more than 10 analogs. Kirromycin binds to the domain 1,2 interface of elongation factor Tu. This interaction maintains the EF-Tu*GTP conformation even after GTP is hydrolyzed to GDP. EF-Tu*GDP normally releases aa-tRNA and then exits the ribosome; however, kirromycin*EF-Tu*GDP*aa-tRNA forms a strong complex and remains bound to the ribosome, prohibits translocation of the peptide chain and translation is halted.

Aurodox is an elongation factor Tu inhibiting antibiotic. It was first referred to as X-5108. It is produced by Streptomyces goldiniensis var. goldiniensis and is active primarily against gram-positive bacteria.

Efrotomycin is produced by Streptomyces lactamodurans NRRL 3802. This kirromycin-like antibiotic is used in animal agriculture, especially in the production of swine. Generally gram negative bacteria are susceptible to efrotomycin, while gram positive bacteria are resistant.

GE2270A is the model molecule of cyclic thiazolyl peptide elfamycins. nGE2270A is produced by Planobispora rosea. Biosynthesis of the molecule has been shown to originate as a ribosomally synthesized peptide that undergoes significant post-translational modification. Clinical use of cyclic thiazolyl peptides is hindered by their low water solubility and bioavailability.

Enacyloxin IIa is structurally distinct but acts in a similar mechanism to kirromycin-like elfamycins. It prohibits the transfer of the amino acid at the A site to the elongating peptide chain. It is most likely that the mechanism of action is that EF-Tu*GDP is locked in the EF-Tu*GTP form, and EF-Tu*GDP*aa-tRNA is immobilized on the ribosome. It is an open question whether enacyloxin IIa actually belongs to the kirromycin-like group of elfamycins due to their high similarity.
Kirrothricin is produced by Streptomyces cinnamoneus and is structurally related to kirromycin, aurodox, heneicomycin and shares a similar spectrum of antibacterial activity.
Azdimycin is produced by Streptomyces diastatochromogenes ATCC 31013.
Dihydromocimycin is produced by Streptomyces ramocissimus CBS190.69.

Phenelfamycin A was isolated from two environmental isolates called AB999F-80 and AB1047T-33. They were both identified as Streptomyces violaceoniger strains. Both these strains were found to produce phenelfamycins A-F and unphenelfamycin. Phenelfamycin A has a monosaccaride moeity and is isomeric with phenelfamycin B. All phenelfamycins were selected due to their activity against anaerobic bacteria, especially Clostridium difficile.

Phenelfamycin B was isolated from two environmental isolates called AB999F-80 and AB1047T-33. They were both identified as Streptomyces violaceoniger strains. Both these strains were found to produce phenelfamycins A-F and unphenelfamycin. Phenelfamycin B has a monosaccaride moeity and is isomeric with phenelfamycin A. All phenelfamycins were selected due to their activity against anaerobic bacteria, especially Clostridium difficile.

Phenelfamycin C was isolated from two environmental isolates called AB999F-80 and AB1047T-33. They were both identified as Streptomyces violaceoniger strains. Both these strains were found to produce phenelfamycins A-F and unphenelfamycin. Phenelfamycin C has a disaccaride moeity and is isomeric with phenelfamycin D. All phenelfamycins were selected due to their activity against anaerobic bacteria, especially Clostridium difficile.

Phenelfamycin D was isolated from two environmental isolates called AB999F-80 and AB1047T-33. They were both identified as Streptomyces violaceoniger strains. Both these strains were found to produce phenelfamycins A-F and unphenelfamycin. Phenelfamycin D has a disaccaride moeity and is isomeric with phenelfamycin C. All phenelfamycins were selected due to their activity against anaerobic bacteria, especially Clostridium difficile.

Phenelfamycin E was isolated from two environmental isolates called AB999F-80 and AB1047T-33. They were both identified as Streptomyces violaceoniger strains. Both these strains were found to produce phenelfamycins A-F and unphenelfamycin. Phenelfamycin E has a trisaccaride moeity and is isomeric with phenelfamycin F. All phenelfamycins were selected due to their activity against anaerobic bacteria, especially Clostridium difficile. Phenelfamycin E and F are the most potent of the phenelfamycins.

Phenelfamycin F was isolated from two environmental isolates called AB999F-80 and AB1047T-33. They were both identified as Streptomyces violaceoniger strains. Both these strains were found to produce phenelfamycins A-F and unphenelfamycin. Phenelfamycin F has a trisaccaride moeity and is isomeric with phenelfamycin E. All phenelfamycins were selected due to their activity against anaerobic bacteria, especially Clostridium difficile. Phenelfamycin E and F are the most potent of the phenelfamycins.

Unphenelfamycin was isolated from two environmental isolates called AB999F-80 and AB1047T-33. They were both identified as Streptomyces violaceoniger strains. Both these strains were found to produce phenelfamycins A-F and unphenelfamycin. Unphenelfamycin has a monosaccaride moeity and lacks the phenacetyl moeity present in the other phenelfamycins. All phenelfamycins were selected due to their activity against anaerobic bacteria, especially Clostridium difficile.
L-681217 is a kirromycin-like antibiotic produced by Streptomyces cattleya. Its biosynthetic gene cluster is characterized.

GE37468 is a thiazolyl peptide produced by Streptomyces ATCC 55365. GE37468 is produced by post-transcription modification of a ribosomally synthesized preprotein, of which the biosynthetic gene cluster has been elucidated.

Amythiamicin A is a cyclic thiazolyl peptide antibiotic with a structure similar to GE2270A. Amythiamicin B, C, and D also exist, but are not discussed further here. Amythiamicin A was shown to have the highest activity in cell free protein synthesis assays.
Heneicomycin is a kirromycin-like antibiotic, isolated from Streptomyces filipinensis. It is structurally related to kirromycin, aurodox and efrotomycin.

Erm(30) confers a MLSb resistant phenotype. Along with erm(31), these genes are responsible for self-resistance in the pikromycin/narbomycin/methymycin/neomethymycin producer, Streptomyces venezuelae.
A gentamicin-group aminoglycoside isolated from Micromonospora.
A semisynthetic genamicin-group aminoglycoside, derived from verdamicin.
An unusual aminoglycoside because the cyclitol ring is not amino substituted; it was discovered as a fermentation product of Streptomyces kasugaensis.
Non-erm 23S ribosomal RNA methyltransferases modify guanosine 748 (E. coli numbering) to confer resistance to some macrolides and lincosamides

TlrB is a methyltransferase found in Streptomyces fradiae and confers resistance to mycinamicin, tylosin and lincosamides. Specifically, this enzyme adds a methyl group to guanosine 748 (E. coli numbering). TlrB is found in the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is one mechanism by which S. fradiae protects itself from self-destruction when producing this macrolide.

myrA is a methyltransferase found in Micromonospora griseorubida and confers resistance to mycinamicin, tylosin and lincosamides. Specifically, this enzyme adds a methyl group to guanosine 748 (E. coli numbering) of 23S ribosomal RNA. MyrA is found in the mycinamicin biosynthetic cluster and is one mechanism by which M. griseorubida protects itself from self-destruction when producing this macrolide.

RlmA(II) is a methyltransferase found in Streptococcus pneumoniae and confers resistance to mycinamicin, tylosin and lincosamides. Specifically, this enzyme adds a methyl group to guanosine 748 (E. coli numbering) of 23S ribosomal RNA.

ChrB is a methyltransferase found in Streptomyces bikiniensis and confers resistance to chalcomycin, mycinamicin, tylosin and lincosamides. Specifically, this enzyme adds a methyl group to guanosine 748 (E. coli numbering). chrB is found in the chalcomycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance in S. bikiniensis.

ErmO is a methyltransferase found in the spiramycin producer Streptomyces ambofaciens. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers only one methyl group. The gene is responsible for self-resistance to spiramycin.

ErmS is a methyltransferase found in the tylosin producer Streptomyces fradiae. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers two methyl groups. The gene is found within the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance

ErmU is a methyltransferase found in the lincomycin producer Streptomyces lincolnensis. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers only one methyl group. The gene is found in the lincomycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.

ErmW is a methyltransferase found in the mycinamicin producer Micromonospora griseorubida. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. The gene is found within the mycinamicin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.
vgbA inactivates streptogramin B-type antibiotics by linearizing the lactone ring on the ester bond using an elimination mechanism, thus conferring resistance to these compounds.
VgbB inactivates streptogramin B-type antibiotics by linearizing the lactone ring on the ester bond through an elimination mechanism, thus conferring resistance.

Cyclic thiazolyl peptide elfamycins inhibit protein synthesis by preventing the formation of the EF-Tu*GTP-aa-tRNA ternary complex, a mechanism similar to that of pulvomycin. There are non-elfamycin cyclic thiazolyl peptide antibiotics which inhibit protein synthesis by by targeting the 50S ribosomal subunit and are not discussed here further.

Kirromycin-like antibiotics bind to the domain 1,2 interface of elongation factor Tu. This interaction maintains the EF-Tu*GTP conformation even after GTP is hydrolyzed to GDP. EF-Tu*GDP normally releases aa-tRNA and then exits the ribosome; however, kirromycin*EF-Tu*GDP*aa-tRNA forms a strong complex and remains bound to the ribosome, prohibits translocation of the peptide chain and translation is halted.
Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to elfamycin antibiotics.
Sequence variants of elongation factor Tu that confer resistance to elfamycin antibiotics.

Efflux protein facT confers resistance to factumycin. The gene has been heterologously expressed in S. coelicolor and its function was confirmed (Thaker et al. Med. Chem. Commun. 2012, 3: 1020). It is possible that this gene can efflux other kirromycin-like elfamycins, but this has not been tested.
Retapamulin is a semi-synthetic pleuromutilin antibiotic approved for the treatment of skin infections.
Two semi-synthetic pleuromutilin derivatives, tiamulin and valnemulin, have been developed as antibiotics for veterinary use.
Azamulin is a semi-synthetic pleuromutilin derivative that failed Stage 1 clinical trials due to poor bioavailability.

Pleuromutilin is a natural product antibiotic produced by Clitopilus passeckerianus. Related antibiotics of clinical significance, such as tiamulin and retapamulin, are semi-synthetic derivatives of this compound.
Narrow spectrum macrocyclic antibiotics, in the general sense, is a cyclic molecule containing more than 12 atoms in the macrocyclic lactone ring.

A narrow spectrum antibiotic effective against Clostridium difficile infection (CDI). It is active against gram positive and gram negative bacteria by inhibiting RNA polymerase's switch region leading to cell death.

SB22484 antibiotics are of the same chemical group as kirromycins. SB22484 antibiotics are produced by Streptomyces sp. NRRL 15496. There are two SB22484 isomers with the same UV absorption spectra, but differing molecular masses. These antibiotics are strongly active against Neisseria species, but also show activity against Streptococci, and Haemophilus influenzae.

UK-69,753 is a glycosylated form of factumycin. The disaccharide moiety of UK-69,753 is virtually identical to that of efrotomycin, another member of this class of antibiotics. UK-69,753 has been shown to have strong in vitro and in vivo activity toward a swine pathogen, Treponema hyodysenteriae.

Phenelfamycin G is produced by Streptomyces albospinus strain Acta 3619. Phenelfamycin G and H are isomeric and similar to phenelfamycin E and F only with the addition of a hydroxyl group at position C-30. Phenelfamycin G and H have a narrow antibacterial spectrum with potent activity against Propionibacterium acnes.

Phenelfamycin H is produced by Streptomyces albospinus strain Acta 3619. Phenelfamycin G and H are isomeric and similar to phenelfamycin E and F only with the addition of a hydroxyl group at position C-30. Phenelfamycin G and H have a narrow antibacterial spectrum with potent activity against Propionibacterium acnes.

One of a small group of kirromycin-like elfamycins which lack the pyridone moiety. Ganefromycin is produced by Streptomyces lydicus spp. tanzanius, and was considered for use as a growth promoting antibiotic in agriculture.
A multidrug and toxic compound extrusions (MATE) transporter conferring resistance to norfloxacin, doxorubicin and acriflavine.
Multidrug efflux pump in E. coli. This multidrug efflux system was originally identified as the Cmr/CmlA chloramphenicol exporter.

The MdtG protein, also named YceE, appears to be a member of the major facilitator superfamily of transporters, and it has been reported, when overexpressed, to increase fosfomycin and deoxycholate resistances. mdtG is a member of the marA-soxS-rob regulon.

OXY beta-lactamases are chromosomal class A beta-lactamases that are found in Klebsiella oxytoca. At constitutive low levels, OXY beta-lactamases confer resistance to aminopenicillins and carboxypenicillins. At high induced levels, OXY beta-lactamases confer resistance to penicillins, cephalosporins and aztreonam.

An enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Enterobacter cloacae by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule. It depends on the cofactors Manganese (II) and Potassium and uses Glutathione (GSH) as the nucleophilic molecule.

murA or UDP-N-acetylglucosamine enolpyruvyl transferase catalyses the initial step in peptidoglycan biosynthesis and is inhibited by fosfomycin. Overexpression of murA through mutations confers fosfomycin resistance.
pp-flo is a plasmid chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Photobacterium damselae subsp. piscicida
lmrB is a chromosomally-encoded efflux pump that confers resistance to lincosamides in Bacillus subtilis
clbA is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus velezensis (Bacillus amyloliquefaciens subsp. plantarum).
clbB is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus brevis
clbC is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus clausii
carA is an ABC transporter involved in macrolide resistance. It is found in Streptomyces thermotolerans
MsrB is an ABC-efflux pump expressed to Staphylococcus species that confers resistance to erythromycin and streptogramin B antibiotics. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
msrC is a chromosomal-encoded ABC-efflux pump expressed in Enterococcus faecium that confers resistance to erythromycin and other macrolide and streptogramin B antibiotics.
ErmH is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Streptomyces thermotolerans
ErmV is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Streptomyces viridochromogenes
ErmY is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Staphylococcus aureus
EreA2 is an integron-encoded erythromycin esterase that hydrolyses the drug's lactone ring. EreA2 is found in Providencia stuartii

tlrC is an efflux pump found in Streptomyces fradiae and confers resistance to mycinamicin, tylosin and lincosamides. tlrC is found in the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is one mechanism by which S. fradiae protects itself from self-destruction when producing this macrolide.
srmB is an efflux pump found in Streptomyces ambofaciens that confers resistance to spiramycin
vgaA is an efflux protein expressed in staphylococci that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
vgaALC is an efflux protein expressed in staphylococci that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
vgaC is an efflux protein expressed in staphylococci that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
vgaD is an efflux protein expressed in Enterococcus faecium that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
vgaE is an efflux protein expressed in staphylococci that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with transposon DNA.
lnuA is a plasmid-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Staphylococcus chromogenes
lnuB is a plasmid-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Streptococcus lutetiensis
lnuC is a transposon-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Streptococcus agalactiae
lnuD is a plasmid-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Streptococcus uberis
lnuF is an integron-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Escherichia coli
vatA is a plasmid-mediated acetyltransferase found in Staphylococcus aureus
vatB is a plasmid-mediated acetyltransferase found in Staphylococcus aureus
vatC is a plasmid-mediated acetyltransferase found in Staphylococcus cohnii
vatD is a transposon-mediated acetyltransferase found in Enterococcus faecium
vatE is a transposon-mediated acetyltransferase found in Enterococcus faecium
vatH is a plasmid-mediated acetyltransferase found in Enterococcus faecium
arr-1 is a chromosome-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Mycobacterium smegmatis
arr-2 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
arr-3 is a plasmid-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Vibrio fluvialis
arr-4 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
arr-5 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
arr-7 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
arr-8 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Klebsiella oxytoca
dfrA1 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Escherichia coli
dfrA2d is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Enterobacteriaceae
dfrA24 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Escherichia coli
dfrA26 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Escherichia coli
dfrA12 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Vibrio cholerae
dfrA14 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Escherichia coli
dfrA17 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Escherichia coli
dfrA5 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Vibrio cholerae
dfrA7 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Escherichia coli
dfrA8 is a transposon-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Salmonella enterica
dfrB1 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
dfrC is a chromosome-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Staphylococcus aureus
dfrD is a plasmid-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Listeria monocytogenes
dfrF is a chromosome-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Streptococcus pyogenes
dfrG is a plasmid-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Staphylococcus aureus
dfrK is a plasmid-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Staphylococcus aureus
tet34 causes the activation of Mg2+-dependent purine nucleotide synthesis, which protects the protein synthesis pathway. It is found in Gram-negative Vibrio
tet37 is a chromosome-encoded oxidoreductase isolated from an uncultured bacterium that confers resistance to tetracycline

An enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Escherichia coli by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule. It depends on the cofactors Manganese (II) and Potassium and uses Glutathione (GSH) as the nucleophilic molecule.

A thiol transferase that leads to the resistance of fosfomycin in Enterococcus faecium. Contrasting FosA, FosB is dependent on the cofactor Magnesium (II) and uses either bacillithiol to open up the epoxide ring of fosfomycin.
FosC2 is an enzyme that phosphorylates fosfomycin to confer resistance in Escherichia coli
dfrE is a chromosome-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Enterococcus faecalis

Arabinosyl transferases allow for the polymerization of arabinose to form arabinan. Arabinan is required for formation of mycobacterial cell walls and arabinosyltransferases are targets of the drug ethambutol. Mutations in these genes can confer resistance to ethambutol.
Bacillus cereus beta-lactamase I is a zinc metallo-beta-lactamase that hydrolyzes a large number of penicillins and cephalosporins in the Bacillus cereus strain 569/H/9
Bacillus cereus beta-lactamase II is a zinc metallo-beta-lactamase that hydrolyzes a large number of penicillins and cephalosporins in the Bacillus cereus strain 5/B/6
linG is an integron-associated gene cassette, with aadA2, encoding a lincosomide nucleotidyltransferase found in Salmonella enterica. linG confers resistance to lincosomide antibiotics.
lmrC is a chromosomally-encoded efflux pump that confers resistance to lincosamides in Streptomyces lincolnensis and Lactococcus lactis. It can dimerize with lmrD
lmrD is a chromosomally-encoded efflux pump that confers resistance to lincosamides in Streptomyces lincolnensis and Lactococcus lactis. It can dimerize with lmrC
rgt1438 is a glycosyltransferase that confers rifampin resistance in Streptomyces
iri is a monooxygenase that confers resistance to rifampin found in Rhodococcus equi
otr(A) is an oxytetracycline resistance ribosomal protection protein found in Streptomyces rimosus
otr(B) is a tetracycline resistance efflux pump found in Streptomyces rimosus
tcr3 is a tetracycline efflux pump that confers self-resistance to Streptomyces aureofaciens
otrC is a tetracycline resistance efflux pump found in Streptomyces rimosus

SAT-1 is a plasmid-mediated streptothricin acetyltransferase, which confers resistance to streptothricin, a nucleoside antibiotic. Originally described from an E. coli plasmid sequence by Heim et al., 1989. SAT-2 is an identical peptide sequence also described from an E. coli plasmid by Tietze et al., 1990.

SAT-4 is a plasmid-mediated streptothricin acetyltransferase and streptothricin (a nucleoside antibiotic) resistant determinant. Originally described from a Campylobacter coli BE/G4 plasmid gene sequence by Jacob et al, 1994.
SAT-3 is a plasmid-mediated streptothricin acetyltransferase and streptothricin resistance determinant. Originally described from an E. coli plasmid gene by Tietze and Brevet, 1995.
van genes that are involved in activating and regulating transcription of gene clusters
van ligases synthesize alternative substrates for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduce vancomycin binding affinity.
VanE is a D-Ala-D-Ala ligase homolog that can synthesize D-Ala-D-Ser, an alternative substrate for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduces vancomycin binding affinity in Enterococcus faecalis

VanF is a D-Ala-D-Ala ligase homolog that can synthesize D-Ala-D-Lac, an alternative substrate for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduces vancomycin binding affinity. It is associated with both vancomycin and teicoplanin resistance in Paenibacillus popilliae
VanG is a D-Ala-D-Ala ligase homolog that can synthesize D-Ala-D-Ser, an alternative substrate for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduces vancomycin binding affinity in Enterococcus faecalis
VanL is a D-Ala-D-Ala ligase homolog that can synthesize D-Ala-D-Ser, an alternative substrate for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduces vancomycin binding affinity in Enterococcus faecalis

VanM is a D-Ala-D-Ala ligase homolog that can synthesize D-Ala-D-Lac, an alternative substrate for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduces vancomycin binding affinity. It is associated with both vancomycin and teicoplanin resistance.
VanN is a D-Ala-D-Ala ligase homolog that can synthesize D-Ala-D-Ser, an alternative substrate for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduces vancomycin binding affinity in Enterococcus faecium

VanO is a D-Ala-D-Ala ligase homolog that can synthesize D-Ala-D-Lac, an alternative substrate for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduces vancomycin binding affinity. It is associated with both vancomycin and teicoplanin resistance.
vanJ is a novel membrane protein that confers resistance to teicoplanin and its derivatives in Streptomyces coelicolor by recycling undecaprenol pyrophosphate during cell wall biosynthesis.

VanK is a member of the Fem family of enzymes that add the cross-bridge amino acids to the stem pentapeptide of cell wall precursors in Streptomyces coelicolor that confers inducible, high-level vancomycin resistance
vanV is an accessory protein of van operons, first identified in the vanB operon. It is not required for vancomycin resistance.

Homologous to vanC, contains a D-Ala-D-Ser ligase. The plasmid-located vanM gene cluster is inducible and confers low resistance to vancomycin. vanN organisms remain susceptible to teicoplanin. Gene orientation: N(XY)TRS

Homologous to vanA, contains a D-Ala-D-Lac ligase. The chromosome-located vanO gene cluster is inducible. Not much is known about the biochemistry about the vanO gene cluster. Gene orientation: orf1 RS orf2 HOX
vanRA, also known as vanR, is a vanR variant found in the vanA gene cluster
vanRB is a vanR variant found in the vanB gene cluster
vanRC is a vanR variant found in the vanC gene cluster
vanRD is a mutated vanR variant found in the vanD gene cluster that caused constitutive expression of vanD peptidoglycan synthesis
vanRE is a vanR variant found in the vanE gene cluster
vanRF is a vanR variant found in the vanF gene cluster
vanRG is a vanR variant found in the vanG gene cluster
vanRL is a vanR variant found in the vanL gene cluster
vanRM is a vanR variant found in the vanM gene cluster
vanRN is a vanR variant found in the vanN gene cluster
vanRO is a vanR variant found in the vanO gene cluster
vanSA, also known as vanS, is a vanS variant found in the vanA gene cluster
vanSB is a vanS variant found in the vanB gene cluster
vanSC is a vanS variant found in the vanC gene cluster
vanSD is a mutated vanS variant found in the vanD gene cluster that caused constitutive expression of vanD peptidoglycan synthesis
vanSE is a vanS variant found in the vanE gene cluster

vanSG is a vanS variant found in the vanG gene cluster

vanSO is a vanS variant found in the vanO gene cluster

vanHD is a vanH variant in the vanD gene cluster
vanHF is a vanH variant in the vanF gene cluster
vanHM is a vanH variant in the vanM gene cluster
vanHO is a vanH variant in the vanO gene cluster

vanXB is a vanX variant found in the vanB gene cluster
vanXF is a vanX variant found in the vanF gene cluster
vanXM is a vanX variant found in the vanM gene cluster
vanXO is a vanX variant found in the vanO gene cluster
vanYA, also known as vanY, is a vanY variant found in the vanA gene cluster
vanYB is a vanY variant found in the vanB gene cluster
vanYD is a vanY variant found in the vanD gene cluster
vanYF is a vanY variant found in the vanF gene cluster
vanYG1 is a vanY variant found in the vanG gene cluster
vanYM is a vanY variant found in the vanM gene cluster
vanZA, also known as vanZ, is a vanZ variant found in the vanA gene cluster
vanZF is a vanZ variant found in the vanF gene cluster
vanWB, also known as vanW, is a vanW variant found in the vanB gene cluster
vanWG is a vanW variant found in the vanG gene cluster
vanXYC is a vanXY variant found in the vanC gene cluster
vanXYE is a vanXY variant found in the vanE gene cluster
vanXYL is a vanXY variant found in the vanL gene cluster
vanXYN is a vanXY variant found in the vanN gene cluster
vanTC is a vanT variant found in the vanC gene cluster
vanTE is a vanT variant found in the vanE gene cluster
vanTG is a vanT variant found in the vanG gene cluster
vanTmL is a vanT variant found in the vanL gene cluster. vanTmL codes for the membrane-binding domain of vanTL
vanTrL is a vanT variant found in the vanL gene cluster. vanTrL codes for the racemase component of vanT
vanTN is a vanT variant found in the vanN gene cluster

term.name: gene(s) or protein(s) associated with a glycopeptide resistance cluster

def.defstr: Van genes encode for various proteins that are involved in conferring vancomycin and teicoplanin resistance.
van ligases that synthesize D-Ala-D-Lac, an alternative peptidoglycan substrate that confers resistance to vancomycin
van ligases that synthesize D-Ala-D-Ser, an alternative peptidoglycan substrate that confers resistance to vancomycin

Aspergillomarasmine A, a fungal natural product, has been shown to inhibit the NDM-1 and VIM-2 enzymes, restoring of the activity of meropenem against carbapenem-resistant pathogens possessing either NDM-1 or VIM-2.
AmrAB is an RND efflux system that impairs aminoglycoside accumulation in clinical Burkholderia vietnamiensis strains
amrA is the efflux pump subunit of the AmrAB-OprM multidrug efflux complex. amrA corresponds to 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 and 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.
amrB is the membrane fusion protein of the AmrAB-OprM multidrug efflux complex.
Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to polymyxin antibiotics, i.e. colistin.

arnA modifies lipid A with 4-amino-4-deoxy-L-arabinose (Ara4N) which allows gram-negative bacteria to resist the antimicrobial activity of cationic antimicrobial peptides and antibiotics such as polymyxin. arnA is found in E. coli and P. aeruginosa.
bacA is a gene that recycles undecaprenyl pyrophosphate during cell wall biosynthesis which confers resistance to bacitracin
bcrA is an ABC transporter found in Bacillus licheniformis that confers bacitracin resistance
bcrB is an ABC transporter found in Bacillus licheniformis that confers bacitracin resistance
AQU beta-lactamases are chromosomal class C beta-lactamases
AQU-1 is a chromosomal class C beta-lactamase found in clinical Aeromonas dhakensis isolates
ROB beta-lactamases are a class A beta-lactamases.
ROB-1 is a beta-lactamase found in Pasteurella and Haemophilus
LCR beta-lactamase is a class D beta-lactamase
LCR-1 is a class D beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
CblA beta-lactamase is a class A beta-lactamase
CblA-1 beta-lactamase is a class A beta-lactamase found in Bacteroides uniformis that is species-specific.
cfxA beta-lactamases are class A beta-lactamases
cfxA beta-lactamase is a class A beta-lactamase found in Bacteroides vulgatus
cfxA2 beta-lactamase is a class A beta-lactamase found in Prevotella intermedia
cfxA3 beta-lactamase is a class A beta-lactamase found in Capnocytophaga ochracea
cfxA4 beta-lactamase is a class A beta-lactamase found in Bacteroides fragilis
blt is an MFS efflux pump that confers resistance to multiple drugs such as rhodamine and acridine dyes, and fluoroquinolone antibiotics
bmr is an MFS antibiotic efflux pump that confers resistance to multiple drugs including acridine dyes, fluoroquinolone antibiotics, chloramphenicol, and puromycin
CeoAB is an RND efflux system that confers multidrug resistance in Burkholderia cenocepacia
ceoA is a periplasmic linker subunit of the CeoAB-OpcM efflux pump
ceoB is a cytoplasmic membrane component of the CeoAB-OpcM efflux pump
dfrA10 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
dfrA13 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Escherichia coli
dfrA15 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Vibrio cholerae
dfrA16 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Salmonella enterica
dfrA19 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
dfrA20 is a plasmid-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Pasteurella multocida
dfrA21 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Salmonella enterica
dfrA22 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Salmonella enterica
dfrA23 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Salmonella enterica
dfrA25 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Salmonella agona
dfrB2 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in an uncultured bacterium from a wastewater treatment plant
dfrB3 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Klebsiella oxytoca
dfrB6 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Salmonella enterica
Enzymes, other proteins and other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to fusidic acid.
Enzymes that confer resistance to fusidic acid by inactivation
fusH is a highly specific fusidic acid esterase found in Streptomyces lividans
lmrAB operon is involved in lincosamide resistance in Bacillus subtilis
lmrA is the repressor to the lmrAB operon in Bacillus subtilis. lmrA mutations result in lincomycin resistance.

MexVW-OprM is a multidrug efflux protein expressed in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexV is the membrane fusion protein; MexW is the RND-type membrane protein; and OprM is the outer membrane channel. MexVW-OprM is associated with resistance to fluoroquinolones, tetracycline, chloramphenicol, erythromycin and acriflavine.
MexV is the membrane fusion protein of the MexVW-OprM multidrug efflux complex.
MexW is the RND-type membrane protein of the efflux complex MexVW-OprM.

MexXY-OprM is a multidrug efflux protein expressed in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexY is the membrane fusion protein; MexX is the RND-type membrane protein; and OprM is the outer membrane channel. MexXY-OprM is associated with resistance to acriflavine, erythromycin, norfloxacin and ofloxacin. The efflux system may also be involved in acquisition of higher resistance, in particular when bacteria are repeatedly exposed to subinhibitory doses of AGs.
MexY is the RND-type membrane protein of the efflux complex MexXY-OprM.
MexX is the membrane fusion protein of the MexXY-OprM multidrug efflux complex.
mfpA is a qnr homolog and a pentapeptide repeat protein that confers resistance to fluoroquinolones in Mycobacterium smegmatis
oleB is an ABC transporter in Streptomyces antibioticus and is involved in oleandomycin secretion
OpcM is an outer membrane factor protein found in Burkholderia cepacia. It is part of the CeoAB-OpcM complex.

MexXY-OprA is a multidrug efflux protein expressed in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexY is the membrane fusion protein; MexX is the RND-type membrane protein; and OprA is the outer membrane channel. MexXY-OprA is associated with resistance to aminoglycosides
OprA is an outer membrane factor protein found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. It is part of the MexXY-OprA complex.

Pencillin-binding proteins are transpeptidase proteins essential for cell wall synthesis. PBPs bind to penicillin antibiotics, which inactivates the enzyme and therefore disrupts cell wall synthesis. Multiple mechanisms and determinants are implicated in antibiotic resistant PBP.

term.name: Streptococcus pneumoniae PBP1a conferring resistance to amoxicillin

def.defstr: PBP1a is a penicillin-binding protein found in Streptococcus pneumoniae

term.name: Streptococcus pneumoniae PBP2b conferring resistance to amoxicillin

def.defstr: PBP2b is a penicillin-binding protein found in Streptococcus pneumoniae

term.name: Streptococcus pneumoniae PBP2x conferring resistance to amoxicillin

def.defstr: PBP2x is a penicillin-binding protein found in Streptococcus pneumoniae
qacA is a subunit of the qac multidrug efflux pump
qacB is a subunit of the qac multidrug efflux pump
rosA is part of an efflux pump/potassium antiporter system (RosAB) in Yersinia that confers resistance to cationic antimicrobial peptides such as polymyxin B.
rosB is part of an efflux pump/potassium antiporter system (RosAB) in Yersinia that confers resistance to cationic antimicrobial peptides such as polymyxin B.
SmeABC is a multidrug resistance efflux pump that confers resistance to aminoglycosides, beta-lactams, and fluoroquinolones in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeA is the membrane fusion protein of the smeABC multidrug efflux complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeB is the inner membrane multidrug exporter of the efflux complex smeABC in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeC is an outer membrane multidrug efflux protein of the smeABC complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
SmeDEF is a multidrug resistance efflux pump that confers resistance to quinolones, tetracyclines, macrolides, chloramphenicol, and novobiocin in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeD is the membrane fusion protein of the smeDEF multidrug efflux complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeE is the RND protein of the efflux complex smeDEF in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeF is an outer membrane multidrug efflux protein of the smeDEF complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
tmrB is an ATP-binding tunicamycin resistance protein found in Bacillus subtilis
tsnR is a 23S ribosomal RNA methyltransferase that methylates adenosine-1067 to confer resistance to thiostrepton
vph is a phosphotransferase that confers resistance to viomycin in Streptomyces vinaceus
ykkCD is a multidrug efflux pump with two SMR-type protein subunits that confers resistance to cationic drugs, chloramphenicol, streptomycin and tetracycline.
ykkC is an SMR-type protein that is a subunit of the ykkCD efflux pump
ykkD is an SMR-type protein that is a subunit of the ykkCD efflux pump
Non-erm 23S ribosomal RNA methyltransferases modify adenosine 1067 to confer resistance to peptide antibiotics
smeR is the responder component of a two component signal transduction system that includes smeS
smeS is the protein kinase sensor component of a two component signal transduction system that includes smeR
smeRS is a two component regulatory system for smeABC where smeR is a response regulator, while smeS is a sensor kinase.
vanXYG is a vanXY variant found in the vanG gene cluster
vanXD is a vanX variant found in the vanD gene cluster
mphE is a macrolide phosphotransferase that phosphorylates macrolides in GTP- dependent manner at 2'-OH hydroxyl of desosamine sugar of macrolides.
Bacillus Cluster A mph are chromosomally-encoded macrolide phosphotransferases that inactivate 14- and 15-membered macrolides such as erythromycin, clarithromycin, azithromycin.

term.name: determinant of resistance to lipopeptide antibiotics

def.defstr: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to lipopeptide antibiotics.

term.name: Staphylococcus aureus cls conferring resistance to daptomycin

def.defstr: cls or cardiolipin synthetase is an inner membrane protein that is involved in membrane synthesis. Specific mutations in S. aureus can confer resistance to daptomycin.

liaFSR is a two-component signal transduction pathway in B. subtilis that responds to peptide and lipopeptide antibiotics. The liaFSR two-component system consists of a histidine kinase liaS and the response regulator liaR as well as the accessory protein liaF, which acts as a negative regulator of liaRS-dependent signal transduction. Mutations confer resistance to daptomycin.

term.name: Enterococcus faecalis liaF mutant conferring daptomycin resistance

def.defstr: liaF is an accessory protein that acts as a negative regulator of liaRS signal transduction pathway. Mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

term.name: Enterococcus faecium liaR mutant conferring daptomycin resistance

def.defstr: liaR is a response regulator found in the liaFSR signal transduction pathway. Mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

term.name: Enterococcus faecium liaS mutant conferring daptomycin resistance

def.defstr: liaS is a histidine kinase found in the liaFSR signal transduction pathway. Mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

pgsA or phosphatidylglycerophosphate synthetase is an integral membrane protein involved in phospholipid biosynthesis. It is a CDP-diacylglycerol-glycerol-3-phosphate 3-phosphatidyltransferase. Laboratory experiments have detected mutations conferring daptomycin resistance in Entercoccus.

term.name: daptomycin resistant beta-subunit of RNA polymerase (rpoB)

def.defstr: Daptomycin resistant RNA polymerases include amino acids substitutions which alter expression of the dlt operon, which increases the cell surface positive charge. Known from S. aureus.

MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface of both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins. Mutations in mprF can additionally confer resistance to daptomycin in S. aureus.

term.name: Enterococcus faecium cls conferring resistance to daptomycin

def.defstr: cls or cardiolipin synthetase is an inner membrane protein that is involved in membrane synthesis. Specific mutations in Enterococcus can confer resistance to daptomycin.
CEPH-A3 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas veronii. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein.
imiH is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas hydrophila. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems.
imiS is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas veronii. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems.
cfxA5 beta-lactamase is a class A beta-lactamase found in Bacteroides distasonis
cfxA6 beta-lactamase is a class A beta-lactamase found in an uncultured bacterium
CphA2 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas hydrophila. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein
CphA4 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas allosaccharophila. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein.
cphA5 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas salmonicida. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein.
cphA6 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas veronii. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein.
cphA7 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas jandaei. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein.
cphA8 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas sobria. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein.
dfrA3 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Escherichia coli
Erm42 confers MLSb phenotype in Pasteurella multocida
mef(B) is a macrolide efflux gene located in the vicinity of sul3 in Escherichia coli. There is also a mefB found in Streptococcus agalactiae that confers resistance to macrolides.

MsrE is an ABC-efflux pump expressed to Klebsiella pneumoniae that confers resistance to erythromycin and streptogramin B antibiotics. It is associated with plasmid DNA. It is also 100% identical to ABC-F type ribosomal protection protein Msr(E) which is in multiple species.
catB10 is an integron-encoded variant of the cat gene found in P. aeruginosa
LsaB is an ABC efflux pump expressed in Staphylococcus sciuri. It confers resistance to clindamycin.
LsaC is an ABC efflux pump expressed in Streptococcus agalactiae. It confers resistance to lincomycin, clindamycin, dalfopristin, and tiamulin

OXA-424 is a C-lactamase found in clinical isolates of Acinetobacter baumannii found in China. It is carbapenem resistant.
OXA-425 is a C-lactamase found in clinical isolates of Acinetobacter baumannii. It is carbapenem-resistant
OXA-426 is a beta-lactamase found in clinical isolates of Acinetobacter baumannii. It is carbapenem resistant
CARB-20 is a beta-lactamase found worldwide in Vibrio parahaemolyticus
